title: Luna Moth extortion hackers pose as IT help desks to breach US firms
summary: The data-theft extortion group known as Luna Moth, aka Silent Ransom Group, has ramped up callback phishing campaigns in attacks on legal and financial institutions in the United States. [...]

title: New "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass used in ransomware attack
summary: A new "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass technique is exploited in attacks to bypass SentinelOne's tamper protection feature, allowing threat actors to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) agents to install the Babuk ransomware. [...]

title: Microsoft finds default Kubernetes Helm charts can expose data
summary: Microsoft warns about the security risks posed by default configurations in Kubernetes deployments, particularly those using out-of-the-box Helm charts, which could publicly expose sensitive data. [...]

title: Unofficial Signal app used by Trump officials investigates hack
summary: TeleMessage, an Israeli company that sells an unofficial Signal message archiving tool used by some U.S. government officials, has suspended all services after reportedly being hacked. [...]

title: Darcula PhaaS steals 884,000 credit cards via phishing texts
summary: The Darcula phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform stole 884,000 credit cards from 13 million clicks on malicious links sent via text messages to targets worldwide. [...]
